website_summaries.verdict: For a slightly higher price than the One SL, you get a tiny speaker with a built-in microphone and additional audio customization options.
pros: The One comes loaded with Alexa and is compatible with Google Assistant as well
Excellent sound for the size with sound adjustment options through the Sonos app
Can be paired with an additional One speaker for stereo sound
cons: Limited to streaming through the Sonos app or through a virtual assistant

website_summaries.verdict: With excellent sound and the choice of Alexa or Google Assistant, the Sonos One reaffirms its place as the best smart speaker for the money.
pros: The Sonos One integrates both Alexa and Google Assistant voice control, with better sound quality than any smart speaker at its price
It offers smart home controls from both systems and its far-field microphone performs well
The Sonos One works seamlessly with Sonos multiroom system and can pair with a second One for stereo sound
It also supports Apple AirPlay 2 and Spotify Connect
cons: The One costs twice as much as an Amazon Echo
You can't switch between the Assistant and Alexa on the fly, and need to run setup again
It doesn't work well if you have an Echo within earshot

customer_reviews.title: Was awesome for 10 minutes, reset, repeat
customer_reviews.text: My wife's brother has two Gen 1 of these so I bought one for my wife's birthday. Followed instructions, got it set up. Worked great. Then 10 to 20 minutes later Alexa would say "I'm having trouble understanding" Reset it. Re-set it up, same thing. Over and Over. Called Sonos help number and the wait was 45 minutes. No. Returned for the the Amazon speaker which is half the price. Sonos, get your stuff right before releasing.
customer_reviews.author: damianicus

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but Alexa integration needs work
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great, far better than any other smart speaker I've tried, but the Alexa integration is awful. It won't respond to voice commands the first two or three tries, and the audible chime doesn't seem to work half the time. Hoping it's a software issue that will improve over time, but given the One has been on the market for awhile, not hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Alec S

customer_reviews.title: Device Looses connection randonly,  2.4ghz wifi?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this device. However, the wifi connection is unstable even right beside any of my AP's. The alexa app often says "uh ohh" For $200 you'd expect that the device would work, it doesn't. I never got around to toying with the other Sonos integrations before sending it back (a week of testing)
customer_reviews.author: RandomITGuy

customer_reviews.title: Seamless integration with existing speaker Sonos system.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to have music in our courtyard and on our patio. Upon powering up and pressing the button, you use your phone/tablet’s sonos app to configure the speakers (room name, mono use or a stereo pair). It took just a few moments to get them dialed in. Then, when you decided to play music, you can choose one room or group them together to play the same tunes everywhere. Alexa is handy for controlling the music when you’re outside and don’t want to carry around a phone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: RVwino

customer_reviews.title: Device is useless if your Amazon account is put on hold because of a problem.
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!!! If you have an issue with your account ( like a card expires or gets replaced) they will PUT YOUR ACCOUNT ON HOLD rendering this device completely useless. You are logged out of the device. Once you get your account issue resolved and they reinstate your account the FUN BEGINS as you now have to COMPLETELY SETUP your device as if it was brand new, including setting up your network, logging in with your username and password etc. It's ridiculous and they DO NOT TELL YOU ANYWHERE that this can happen. Forget streaming Spotify or anything else while your account is locked. UNACCEPTABLE. And customer service doesn't care one bit.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Honestly just got for something cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems from this item. Sonos looks awesome but their ecosystem is just a bit of a pain. First, it takes forever to get set up. Between registration and then syncing I probably spent 30 minutes from box to playing. Alexa integration is lacking as well. We had to search well into the app to figure out how to get it going, now half the time Alexa doesn't recognize it, the other half of the time it can't find what we're looking for. Sound quality is good but now what you would expect for the price. If you want the premium ecosystem it makes sense, me...I'm leaning towards trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: 2 speakers stereo set up + echo dot = on cloud 9
customer_reviews.text: Save every penny you earn and get 2 speakers for stereo set up, that extra 200 for second speaker is worth every penny you saved and spent. Forget the Alexa assistance on Sonos One, add the amazon echo for the "real" Alexa; set your Sonos One speakers as preferred speakers. Loving my Sonos one set up and can't wait every morning to listen a few songs before greeting a brand new day; life is good. ITS A BUY!
customer_reviews.author: TEE

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to set up - Returned. Mad that I wasted 4+ hrs on Sonos
customer_reviews.text: I spent 4+ hours trying to set this up and failed. I am in tech industry and regularly setup tech equipment, wifi networks, extended devices, configure routers, etc. I spent 2+ hours talking with Sonos support on phone calls and they could not get their speaker to work. I did 50+ restarts of the iPhone app, 5+ reboots of wifi network; twice custom configuration of router, multiple factory resets, a failed software update. Device only worked when it was within 3 feet of wifi router. 10 feet+ it didn't work. I have 10+ other wifi connected devices 30+ feet away from router, so the problem was not the strength of my wifi signal.
customer_reviews.author: JimPink

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but NOT compatible with other echo devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Sonos speaker with the intention of using it as part of a multi room music group in Alexa, but you can’t unless you purchase more Sonos speakers! I have an Echo Plus in my kitchen, and wanted the Sonos in another room for better quality sound; however it is not available to use at the same time as any Echo device in a multi room music group. Ugh! I am soooo disappointed because the sound is good! My Echo Plus sounds alright, but I wanted better sound in other rooms. So bummed! I am returning to purchase an Echo Input to “hopefully” use with my Bose Sounddock 10. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Christi L.

customer_reviews.title: ALEXA VOICE CONTROL DOES NOT WORK OUTSIDE OF USA!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you plan on controlling directly with Alexa Voice Control outside of the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Wahoo

customer_reviews.title: Get It From Amazon Warehouse..?
customer_reviews.text: I like this speaker. It is solid, producing good, clean sound. Setup was a bit more complicated than Echo products, but it worked out for the second unit. The first had an annoying issue. It was discounted because it had been returned. The prior owner installed it, but when they returned it, they did not “deregister” it. Consequently, I could not finish the installation. There does not appear to be a workaround, and Amazon apparently does not check this. They had to replace it. Caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best sound, period.
customer_reviews.text: So far I can't say enough good things about the Sonos ecosystem. I now own several of these throughout my house and the ability to have them sync up and control them either individually or as a group with Spotify or Apple Music (or others...) is a game changer. It's the kind of thing you didn't know you wanted until you had it. Coming from bluetooth speakers that you have to pair and they're always cutting out if you walk too far with your phone, these are such a pleasure to use. The sound quality is out of this world. I'm not sure I've ever turned them all the way up because I'd probably blow out a window. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound, BUT WILL NOT LOOP Amazon app sleep sounds
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these as part of a surround system with a Sonos ARC & sub. Incredible sound! I have 2 more in the bedroom strictly to play sleep sounds AND LOOP THEM ALL NIGHT. A couple months ago they stopped looping. I put an Amazon Echo next to them and it loops all night long. Sonos One's won't. If you're not concerned with looping, you can't go wrong with these awesome speakers. Just don't expect them to loop Amazon apps that produce sleep sounds. They won't do it.
customer_reviews.author: MikeL

customer_reviews.title: Meets 95% of my wants/needs.
customer_reviews.text: I love having Alexa and the associated skills built-in. My one quibble is not being able to adjust the volume when it is used as a destination for Airplay 2 audio. I need to adjust via the Apple Remote app. I'd like to be able to do that via voice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stack

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound. Great audio interface.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old edition, these are awesome and sounds wonderful! Plus, Alexa plays all my music and orders things for me when I ask. She's getting more convincingly human every day. I got to the point where I say please and thank you to Alexa. Don't disrespect my Alexa. I want the robot or AI Invaders to know I treated her with respect when Alexa was just a toy.
customer_reviews.author: PsychoPro

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: The speaker was all I hoped for. It arrived on time, in perfect condition. You download the Sonos app, connect your music subscription, and you are good to go. Each mobile device that you install a Sonos app on, that has bluetooth capability, and a WIFI signal, can be used to control the speaker. It's great at providing ambiance. I'm sure there are lots of other uses, but I haven't delved into those yet. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Diana P.

customer_reviews.title: Speaker is great, but microphone needs work
customer_reviews.text: It has a rIch bass, with a good quality sound. But the microphone is subpar. With my Echo devices, commands for Alexa are nearly always understood the first time. For the Sonos, it often does not pick up what I am saying. This morning my request to "Play my playlist Colossians" got the response, "I don't see your playlist 'Together.'" Not even close on that one!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon P.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the sound!
customer_reviews.text: After I spent almost $200 for this smart speaker I expected very good sound, especially for music. What a disappointment. While it was somewhat better than the Amazon Alexa smart speaker, it was harder to set up and required downloading the Sonos app to do the setup. I very rarely need the app and will probably never use it again as I don't plan to buy another Sonos product. If you want very good sound for playing music, I recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: SandyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Great product. good sound quality at low/med volumes. Mic not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old Sonos zone player linked to my hifi. Alexa sometimes doesnt acknowledge me first time. I use spotify for music and probably not as good as using with amazon music service. but still pretty acceptable. at full volume , you hear distortion in the bass. its good for a small room but not loud enough or enough base for a party. perfect for everyday use though.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Can't change the 'wake' word, stuck with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: It's not possible to change the wake word, and there doesn't seem to be a plan to fix this. So you're stuck with 'Alexa...' when you have an 'Alex' in the house this gets a little tedious with false triggers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason@reefbreak.co.uk

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: It took me over 3 months to configure the speaker because of WiFi issues (both mine and the speaker itself). Their customer support is awful, taking up to 30 minutes to pick up the phone despite the system always saying there's a "5-minute estimated wait time". If they knew their products well they could have saved a lot of time working with me, and save my time working on the system. The speaker itself is great and I'm satisfied with it - the setup was just awful and Sonos has awful customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but alexa/software needs work
customer_reviews.text: The echo products listen better than this, and hold connection better. so if you dont consider alexa, it is a decent product. used along with other sonos devices in the house, I personally found the software a little difficult to use, there is some user study needed there. to change the song from one product to another is not straightforward or intuitive. similarly the status of the system (whether it is connected to network) is difficult to know. I would added a light somewhere on the side or bottom to indicate few things. the top light is meaningless given that most would put it a height where the top wont be visible.
customer_reviews.author: ak

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy setup, a bit finicky
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with the sound, which has great bass, and can be tuned to its environment (room) using your smart phone/iPad, etc. I use Alexa for voice recognition. Sometimes, however, even with a strong wifi signal, the speaker (or Alexa) seem to trip over "her" initial response, uttering only a non-descript part of one. Most of the time, "she" will respond appropriately, and the vocabulary for input seems pretty large. Pretty good reception range, even to an apartment two doors over.
customer_reviews.author: Missoula woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t play iTunes from iPhone - WTAF
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Sonos One speakers to put in my living room and kitchen, and there’s apparently no way to play my music from iTunes on my phone. Wut. This makes zero sense. Without this feature activated (and can we even call it a feature when YOU LITERALLY HAVE ONE JOB SONOS) these speakers are just two heavy paperweights.
customer_reviews.author: kara

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these to go in different rooms in my house. It was a really easy installation. I love that I can have music or the tv sound follow me through the house. Integration with streaming services and the other devices was quite simple. The speakers are good looking and unobtrusive. Sound seems great. I haven’t used the Alexa integration yet. The app that goes with the speakers is intuitive and simple to use. I’m adding a couple more soon.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderLisa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Speakers when you  get them to work. Awful setup for surround sound.
customer_reviews.text: It took a few days of extreme patience to set these up to work with Sonos playbar. It shouldn't be this hard in 2019. On the plus side, when they work, they are amazing. LOVE them. Which is why I gave them a four-star. Sonos, you really need to improve the setup/connectivity and your APP.
customer_reviews.author: lovesBug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but could use some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent for the price. I think the echo devices that I replaced with the sinus units were more accurate etc. the sonus seems to lose network more easily than a dot even though they are in the same location. But luv the sonus.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Useless out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I unwrapped the Sonos One from the box. Packaging untouched. Downloaded app, followed instructions, but it can't connect to my wifi. I use the same password as my Apple MacBook and iPhone, which connect to wifi, but this Sonos One doesn't. It doesn't have bluetooth so it's currently useless. Terrible wifi connectivity for a product that only functions with wifi and no customer support. Wtf.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound quality, Alexa feature nearly worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I’d say Alexa works about 60% of the time on this. It’s very fickle. In the morning, I basically have to reset it before playing anything for the day, and because it’s not an Amazon device, it does not support drop-in features (I can use it to make announcements, however). Overall, the Sonos aspect of it is absolutely incredible, but there is much left to be desired when it comes to the Alexa functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: As a speaker for music, the sound is very nice for the size. If you have gadgets from Apple, very easy to use with airplay, for others users, it is doable, however it is not that easy. Just would like to more functions were available for Google Assistant, like voice match and being able to connect to non Sonos products to listen to Music in different rooms for example.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with a set up
customer_reviews.text: It’s a proper rubbish! First of all I was still connected to the previous owner. And trying to bypass is seems impossible 🤦‍♂️ This is the worst set up I have ever seen. Get the app/hard wire Ethernet/update/another update/can’t find your speaker/troubleshoot...bollocks. I’m returning this tomorrow. The whole set up feels like it’s 1995. Wast of time/energy and money
customer_reviews.author: DoYoga2008

customer_reviews.title: One of the speakers in a room sounds good. Two of them sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: I have many of these speakers. I have some that don’t have Alexa built-in. This is fine and sounds the same as the Sonos ones. Often Alexa is triggered from conversation in the room. In short if you don’t need Alexa buy the cheaper version of the speaker. Sonos speakers system takes a little while to get used to but eventually you’ll be pretty happy with this product. I would suggest I would suggest having two of these per room. One of the speakers in a room sounds good. Two of them sounds great. Three or four of them sounds amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Connelly

customer_reviews.title: THE Best Small Speakers Even For A 15' x 20' Room!
customer_reviews.text: For my home stereo and TV system, I have a SAMSUNG 83" smart tv, plus SONOS speakers everywhere. Like, a $20,000 system. Don't try to come over some night an steal it, because we have killer Yorkshire terriers who will eat you down to your panties and socks. We got two new SONOS One Gen 2 speakers for a new addition to the home, and the sound is AMAZINGLY crisp, clear, LOUD, and faithful. Love that these little guys sound like the six SONOS 5 speakers we have! The ONEs are that good!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Panski

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you want full echo functionality...it doesn't have it.
customer_reviews.text: You can't send messages and there were a couple other things it wouldn't let me do that I do regularly. The speaker is decent quality and I like the airplay feature (main reason I got it) the echo functionality was going to be a bonus until I realized it won't do every thing an echo will do. Use it as an airplay speaker, sure. As an echo replacement...nope. I just went and bought another echo.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: sonos discontinuing support for "legacy" speakers
customer_reviews.text: I own thousands of dollars of Sonos speakers. And I just bought my first voice-assistant Sonos One for my daughter for Christmas with plans to buy more. What a difference a month makes. Sonos announced this week that they are obsoleting half of my speakers in May 2020. I now regret all of my Sonos purchases and would strongly advise against buying any Sonos products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Yablonowitz

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - SOFTWARE UPDATE BRICKS SPEAKERS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Sonos has totally ruined their speakers with their software update. Half of the speakers in my home will not appear on my app. I am constantly having to re-add them only to have them disappear again. The software update cost me thousands of dollars in useless speakers. I have about a dozen in my home. DO NOT BUY SONOS PRODUCTS. You will end up with expensive, useless bricks throughout your home.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Huge hassle setting up. Mediocre sound for the price...
customer_reviews.text: These are very difficult to complete a setup in one try. I don’t recommend these to anyone who is a tech lamen. I spent over an hour trying to get the setup to complete properly within the Sonos app. Integrating with Alexa was also extremely difficult as it would mess up the speaker setup inside the Sonos app after connecting to Alexa. Forcing me to reset and reconnect all over again. All in all, these speakers are not worth the trouble for the price. If you can get past the setup and you purchase 2 Sonos as I did, the sound is better than the stereo Apple HomePod but not as good as the amazon 3D sound speaker.
customer_reviews.author: PS Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Really like these speakers. This is our second Sonos One and we love it. I have one in the living room and one in the master bedroom. Two major keys to these being at the top our list. 1. Air Play 2 compatible. So simple and way better than Bluetooth 2. Smart Assistant options with both Google and Alexa being an option On top of these two major pluses they sound pretty darned good to boot. Not an audiophile by any sense of the word but the sound they put out is VERY acceptable. Now to build on more speakers. Really, really good!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffxf

customer_reviews.title: Classic Sonos ease of use and sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality; good bass extension with such a small speaker cabinet. Highs can be slightly harsh for my personal taste (I like smooth analog/vinyl sounds), but this is only in comparison to the ribbon tweeters on my studio monitors. TruePlay autoEQ only works with iOS products which I borrowed a friend's iPhone to do. I picked the Sonos since it had Alexa or Google Assistant, depending on the need. Voice recognition not as sensitive as the native google products, but still works very reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Danny T

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for such an inexpensive set
customer_reviews.text: Who get's two fantastic separation and frenquency response from two of these for $400? I have B&W Studio Monitors from 10 years ago and it is approaching the quality of those for $400 a pair....go ahead and get these but beware that the complaints about getting them to work are with Alexa/Amazon which is kind of like Microsoft compared to Apple....It is absolutely flaw free with Airplay or Sonos' on radio app. I have very few problems and Amazon/Alexa resolve within days
customer_reviews.author: V. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchases two of these to create rear channels for the Sonos Soundbar. Installation was a snap. AND I am using these in place of the Amazon ECHO in the room. Thrilled. Hey folks when are you gonna make Alexa smart about "synonyms". I want to say turn on living room ceiling light turn on pendant light [the living room is the only room with a pendant light] turn on the living room overhead light and have all these request turn on the living room light!!
customer_reviews.author: Glen Miranker

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay connected to my WiFi. Needs constant rebooting. Poor tech support.
customer_reviews.text: Completely frustrated with this product and support. Support is quick to close a ticket without hearing/waiting on feedback from instructions. My unit constantly disconnects from my WiFi so I can’t even use with Alexa. Highly disappointed for the money and hype.
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker. Sound quality is great. Alexa integration has issues now and then. I will purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: Ham2293

customer_reviews.title: Google Assistant feature missing
customer_reviews.text: The grill is more white than the photo shows. I expected this to work exactly like a Google home mini, with all the additional functionality of a Sonos, and obviously with better sound quality. That is not true. The most important feature of a Google home mini, as a Chromecast receiver, is NOT part of this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Melton

customer_reviews.title: You cannot use all of Alexa’s features with the Sonos one generation 2 speakers!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot connect Sonos one GEN two to Alexa multi room group. Paid almost $400 for this So called Alexa enabled pair of speakers. Consistently hearing “Having trouble connecting to the network“ and it is driving us nuts! We put the stereo pair in the office hoping we would be able to connect to all of our echo Alexa speakers throughout the house. Kind of wishing I had purchased a pair of Echo studios instead.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Cella

customer_reviews.title: Frequently disconnects and poor Alexa UX
customer_reviews.text: Sonos speakers frequently get unpaired from the group or lose WiFi connection. To remediate you must unplug and replug them or open the Sonos app and repair them. I’ve had issues with the audible integration and Sonos speakers. Alexa voice recognition can also fail to pick up clear commands.
customer_reviews.author: Rootul Patel

customer_reviews.title: VA works anywhere great sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and VA works. I bought the Bose only to discover the VA is not rolled out well outside the USA, Bose did not advertise limited country capability, so disappointing. I was on holiday in Costa Rica. Returned the Bose and ordered this. It got here the day before shutdown. Now I am holed up here with good sound and drinks. Great sound quality, yup I said it twice.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with Alexa and it's been terrific. I like to be able to turn on background music with a simple voice command. I also like that you can set a maximum volume level for the speaker - keeps those who like to blast music too loud at a more reasonable level. As always, Sonos delivered a quality product which fits my needs. I highly recommend these speakers from Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Sonos are always good speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Sonos speakers aren’t the best. So easy to plug in outside or inside and after installing the app it’s so easy to use. Did NOT install the Alexa feature so just using as a basic speaker with my phone and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia's mom

customer_reviews.title: Great compliment to a Sonos soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I got this to add onto my Beam sound bar and it works and sounds amazing. Integration was easy and you can tune it using the Sonos app. I am not sure how it sounds as a stand alone speaker but as the rears for my surround sound, its amazing and a must if you have a sonos soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The speaker looks and sounds great which is why I bought it but the problem is misty that it stops playing constantly. My WiFi signal is sting enough to stream videos on multiple devices and preform other activities but apparently this speaker needs more. It doesn’t matter if the sound quality is good if the speaker doesn’t work otherwise. Sonos kind of comes off as an obtuse company, for example it doesn’t have Bluetooth and you cannot change the Alexa wake word. I would keep the speaker if it had Bluetooth compatibility but it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Steinar Kristoffersen

customer_reviews.title: beware of setting this up
customer_reviews.text: Sonos requires a mobile device, phone or tablet to set up a speaker...cannot be done with a desktop...recently they have changed the software so that Android 6 or before and earlier apple software will not allow set up...I had 4 sonos speakers working and ordered the Sonos one...my phone OS is 5....I had to borrow a neighbor's phone to install....that was ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: clifton b mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker- Alexa - not good
customer_reviews.text: Speaker sounds fantastic. one of the best. If you're looking at this one for Alexa integration, warning, it does not work well. Multi-room setup is very difficult. And once done, it's very spotty. There are numerous articles about how to do it. It is by no means flawless. I would say it works 50% of the time. I now use these exclusively with AirPlay and gave up on Alexa integration. No problems with AirPlay.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Last speakers you will ever need...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 sets of these speakers. Recommend start out with the sound bar and 2 Sono Ones since they are a little pricey but last speakers you will ever need and portable enough with clean look to move with you as you move through life. Set up properly with App, you get awesome movie sound and watching sporting events with them is epic.
customer_reviews.author: Eldon

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers for Wireless Music
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these speakers all over the house now, and it's so nice to be able to control them from my phone, a tablet, or my computer. Enables everyone to play their own music from one music account.
customer_reviews.author: Gem-A-Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound!
customer_reviews.text: I had been listening to music through my echo dot. It was just adequate. The voice controlled Sonos was a huge upgrade! I’m really pleased with the sound quality. I’ve recommended this speaker to multiple people.
customer_reviews.author: aawillis

customer_reviews.title: Play some thing else. Perhaps BOSE
customer_reviews.text: Software is full of bugs. Continuous issues over 10 years. I have a large investment in Sonos and I’m disappointed every day. I was one of your early vocal champions and when you finally changed to a new software and didn’t take care of their early adopters by making their equipment obsolete it just confirmed my sinking feeling that I likely made the wrong choice in home audio. Great sound terrible software maintenance and customer attitude. making products obsolete and charging you a fortune for new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t know what I was missing!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for me from my husband. We used it all summer on a covered porch and the sound quality was perfect for around the pool and the weather resistance made me feel ok about leaving it outside. Now moved inside and still love it! Love the flexibility with Alexa to boot. Loved it so much gave it to my audiophile brother in law for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, non functional for google
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this speaker for Google home compatibility and when Google music was still operational it was okay. A lot of lost functionality over a google device but i could get music working without too much effort. Now with the transition to YouTube music it's almost non functional. I would not buy this right now for google.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this speaker. I have had a few issues with the bluetooth not connecting, but its only been a few times. The sound is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Pfoxco

customer_reviews.title: worst electronic device I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Tired of yelling at Alexa to cooperate. Music will not play, despite Alexa indicating "playing Pandora". Music plays intermittently and shuts off. Alexa also advises me the skill is not active in the Alexa app when clearly it is. Amazon tech support cannot help. Sonos tech support is never available. No device is worth this much aggravation. Total piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: eyeshop2much

customer_reviews.title: Stick with sonos, even for voice control! bye bye echo!!!
customer_reviews.text: best starter sonos product with alexa built in. recommend to put in bedroom with mic off, then push hold mic to summon alexa. much more efficient that way. great way to add airplay to existing sonos system. currently with connect:amp and this sonos one. will be purchasing the move so i can add bluetooth to the system. then i won’t need any echo devices at all. the sound trumps echo anything, any day, regardless of stereo pair or multi room music with echo devices.
customer_reviews.author: James Houston

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product - Quality, Room-Filling Sound
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sonos product, and I couldn't be more pleased. The sound quality is top-notch, and setup was easy. The Alexa setup takes a little longer, but is worth it. I love the Sonos app, (I've only used it on iOS) and 'Trueplay' tuning made some difference in the smaller bedroom where it was placed. Not a knock, but would be great if Sonos offered this size/form as battery operated, similar to the Sonos Move.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Keilholz

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, promising ability to link more speakers to the sound system, works great with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: This speaker sounds so good and works so well, I am going to try pairing it with the second one and maybe even getting the sound bar. If you’re jumping to more expensive smart speakers for sound quality, these guys are a great place to start looking! Are use Alexa, and she works great with the speaker...
customer_reviews.author: W. G. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Your microphone does work
customer_reviews.text: Love Sonos products, but this one comes without any help in connecting Alexa. After an hour searching for help on both Alexa and Sonos apps, I found an online blog with the directions. They worked easily. Not sure why Sonos doesn’t see fit to include them with the setup directions, but here they are as written by a now happy owner: settings/services/voice, select Amazon Alexa, add the speaker, and joy!
customer_reviews.author: K. Roy

customer_reviews.title: Should I break up with Sonos?
customer_reviews.text: Frequently frustrating to use (I have 2 Ones & a beam). The setup is easy but the connectivity is flaky. As I write this review, the speakers have just disconnected from my music streaming through Spotify. (My Internet connection is strong and the router is new before anyone tells me to unplug/reset it) The sound quality is great when it works. It’s like dating someone really hot but then finding out they’re actually a total moron.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Disillusioned with sonos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solely to be able to use AirPlay because the feature I have been using to play songs from my phone on my older sonos devices was removed. When we added this to our network we lost a lot of functionality for controlling the speakers with Alexa, which is really surprising considering this has Alexa built in.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: It does not support Bluetooth and tv speakers
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing. But I can compromise 1% on sound quality for Bose vs Sonos if I find easy compatibility with vise for most of the electronic devices. Sonos says wireless but they have no Bluetooth. It feels like back to 90s 😂 I mean if I am spending 250$+, I will be looking for easy compatibility, tv. I would not recommend this to anyone. I am sure freeing Bose now in the same price range and more compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Sonal Jain

customer_reviews.title: Killer sound
customer_reviews.text: I only live in a small apartment so having monster sound was not my top priority. Set up was super easy and Alexa is a nice touch, I like you can add more speakers along the line if you want to. Overall great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bay33saw

customer_reviews.title: never worked, don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 hours on the item - exercise in torture as it would never work. Had to perform a factory reset on the speaker, use ethernet cable, it messed up our normal wifi for a while but would never leave "updating" mode. Disaster The closest refund place is not our normal UPS either - have to drive 30 minutes to the closest place to send it back. Don't recommend
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Headache
customer_reviews.text: Set up was finicky, Alexa did not integrate well and was actually annoying as compared to my echo show. I ended up getting Play 1 speakers and those were way easier to set up and Alexa worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Hooks up to Alexa and works as an Alexa. Sound is good just thought would be a little louder. All in all these things are great. Purchased a second after the first one was not loud enough to fill the downstairs. Easy to move to any room in the house or outdoors
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Furnari

customer_reviews.title: Alexa doesn't work if you have two different WiFi's either at home or home/gym
customer_reviews.text: Disappointingly, you can't use the Alexa function to run your music applications (Sonos makes you chose from where you want to run your app) nor will Alexa register your device as a controllable device as any other Echo device. They could if the companies (Amazon Alexa or Sonos) wanted but they add restrictions without letting you know in advance!
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: Google Assistant is not fully integrated !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the Google assistant integration. This is a great smart speaker for the acoustics alone. I had a google home that we loved, but wanted something louder for our patio. The integration with google assistant and streaming music is not great and somewhat difficult to integrate ( for instance I cannot ask google to play Sirius Xm). After some troubleshooting I found that Alexa is better for streaming integration, and changed the settings to make it an Alexa Sonos instead of Google assistant. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Law

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Good. Alexa Bad
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker. Purchased it to use for z-wave alerts from my Homeseer and it works as expected. HOWEVER, I also expected it to replace my echo dot, and that did no go so well. The Alex constantly locks up, fails to connect and has other issues requiring ongoing reboots. I am going to just disable it and put my dot back in use, because its too frustrating and undependable. Also while researching the problem, I saw the manufacturer support deflecting and appearing to blame owners WiFi, and other network issues for their devices Alex problems, which has me wondering if they have any intention of ever correcting it. Bottom line, great speaker, bad Alexa implementation.
customer_reviews.author: John W Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker - Alexa Works but NOT with Sonos Music
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, convenient to have Alexa, but planned to use Alexa voice to control my Amazon music but the Alexa integration is terrible and really does not work. If I use the Sonos App, the speakers work great but with Alexa there are huge problems - really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Weisbrod

customer_reviews.title: Can’t add Sonos One to google speaker group was no good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two Sonos One gen 2 to replace google home minis as the Sonos have much better sound quality. Unfortunately even though they are sold as google smart speaker ready the reality is that not all google assistant features are available. To me the most important feature that’s unavailable is the ability to add the Sonos One to a google speaker group. This can’t be done at the moment so I had to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great
customer_reviews.text: Was a little difficult to setup. It had to be Factory Reset, but those instruction did not come with the device. I found that out on Google. Once I got it setup works fine with Alexa. It's a littl expensive have the lower score on values for the money.
customer_reviews.author: bob114

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifully. Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, better than the original. All the convenience of Alexa, with the ability to pick and choose from all the choices the Sonos app gives you. Easy set up, no network troubles. I could not be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: My smart speaker
customer_reviews.text: It's seldom but when I want to hear some music without turning on the whole stereo system, I go to my sonos one. For a single speaker system, it is the best sounding speaker I've got.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but Alexa is limited
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Echo Dot. I have been using the wake work "Echo" throughout my house for over a year now and have created customized audio responses to certain routines. Unfortunately this device only allows the use of "Alexa" as the wake word and does not support the use of customized audio responses and generates a long error message for any routine that uses them. After doing some digging it seems there are a number of other features it is also lacking. I was hoping to get two more of these but have decided to hold off. Hopefully a software update will fix this someday.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: sound quality is superb!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is the best I have experienced in a small bluetooth/wifi speaker. It sounds way better than google home(also have). Still waiting for google home integration(dissapointment). Alexa may be good for home control but you can't beat google for answering questions in my opinion. Using mine in a moderatly sized bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Star

customer_reviews.title: Great desk speaker.
customer_reviews.text: OMG! The sound quality! I’m blown away. I sold all of my google home speakers. This sonos speaker is 1000 times better than google home. The bass is deep. Sound is very good. It set it up on my office, setting on my desk when I’m working this thing can crank out some good beats with some punch.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Sriracha

customer_reviews.title: Lousy wifi speaker
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, sounds is awesome, when it works. I've tried 3 different networks and it won't stay connected for more then 5 minutes, been messing with it for 2 weeks and it just won't keep a signal. Your only option is to plug it in to ethernet.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Completes Our Sonos Family
customer_reviews.text: We added the Sonos One to complement & complete our Sonos collection. Sound is excellent! We love that it is Alexa friendly & use this feature frequently. This is small enough to be unobtrusive but packs a wallop in sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: kimb

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Great connectivity. Sound is just ok for the price. It falls short in the lower bass range. The sub woofer, which lists around $800, is unimpressive and didn’t add much. Airpulse might be a better option for the money but lacks wifi.
customer_reviews.author: M. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Speaker has a great sound and it's nice that Alexa is active for voice controls. I'm having some issues trying to configure this with my echo dot and streaming (i.e. Alexa plays 1 song and stops rather than continue to stream "play songs by...")but pretty sure that's an Amazon issue so no issues with Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: keving

customer_reviews.title: SONOS continues to blow it
customer_reviews.text: You want these to work well so badly - but their Alexa integration is garbage, buggy and unreliable and I was sort of surprised at the sound quality not being what I expected. Its getting so that any Amazon device is just a better option, why have to use a totally separate app and service, and with limited voice control?
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Good music streaming solution
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to add as a mono extension to an existing speaker in the same room. Mission accomplished with minimal effort. Use it both as stand alone with Alexa or connected via WiFi to iTunes music collection on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: carl52

customer_reviews.title: Connection is horrible
customer_reviews.text: The sound is awesome when it decides to work. I never write reviews but felt the need to try to steer any one away from buying these speakers. It connects to your actual WiFi, NOT Bluetooth. For whatever reason that makes connecting these speakers extremely difficult. It never wants to work. Ever. Then if it does, it’s connected for a couple of minutes and then disconnects. There is nothing wrong with my WiFi. I run numerous things on my WiFi and everything connects fine. The connection to Sonos is an absolute nightmare. Do not buy these! Buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Falsely compatible with Google Home
customer_reviews.text: This is my main living room speaker, meant to be used with Google Home. It claims to be compatible but it is not. The whole purpose of this purchase was to sync all my smart speakers together but can’t do that with Sonos. Also it take commands separately so my speakers don’t sync commands. Sonos is not compatible. False advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Debera Bell-Beam

customer_reviews.title: Sonos > Bose
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sounding speaker. I wish I’d gotten a second one when it was on sale and likely will buy another one if the price drops again. Nice looking speaker which I mounted on a Sanus stand and sounds great. I’ve always been a Bose fan but I’ll all in on Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest rip off I’ve encountered recently. The sound is good...when it works. As you have probably read in other reviews, the connection between your Sonos app and the Sonos one is pretty much non-existant. You can drive yourself crazy trying to troubleshoot this speaker, but it will always fail again. Don’t waste any money on this, and it is really expensive. Get a good Bluetooth speaker, stay away from this crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well at first. After 1 year, it stopped connecting to my wifi. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Malika

customer_reviews.title: Alexia what day is it?
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality. Wonderful sound. Alexia can tell me what day it is! I unfortunately got black but had ordered white. Box said white. I was too excited to return & wait for correct to ship. I am enjoying music all day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: very good sound quality. easy to access multiple music sources. I had a problem connecting one speaker of a pair. Support helped online; I was able to send an information dump, and they corrected the problem online. Excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: Catnap

customer_reviews.title: Good sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: These are great little speakers for the money and very versatile. Setup is reasonably good until you have to link a whole house of these (10) back after a router change. Then, things get a little tough. Otherwise, great!
customer_reviews.author: Marc V.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos speakers are the most versatile on the market. They have great sound and can be placed anywhere there is an electrical outlet. In addition, you can play music on a speaker in one room and play different music on a speaker in another room at the same time. I highly endorse this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hallen

customer_reviews.title: Can’t control music with voice.  Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: Alexa doesn’t control the music at all!!! This was an amazing speaker for sound but not controllability. It’s like having a Superman who can fly but isn’t strong enough to carry anything with him. I want a Superman speaker. The next option for me is the amazon studio.
customer_reviews.author: CHris Holland

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Alexa Multi Room Music
customer_reviews.text: The sound is GREAT. But it doesn't work with Amazon Alexa Multi-room music. It has ALexa built in, and you can pout it in a group, but you don't have the ability to have it play the exact same music as other (Alexa) devices at the same time. Due to this, I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ross

product_meta.title: Sonos One (Gen 2) - Voice Controlled Smart Speaker with Amazon Alexa Built-in - Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:1 SpeakerSonos One is the powerful smart speaker with built-in voice control. Get rich, room-filling sound with Sonos one, and control it with voice, the Sonos app, Apple Airplay2, and more. Amazon Alexa is built right in so you can play music, check news, set alarms, get your questions answered, and more, completely hands free. The compact design fits just about any space. Put it on your kitchen countertop or tuck it away on your office bookshelf. It's humidity resistant so you can even put it in the bathroom. Pair two Sonos ones together in the same room for stereo separation and more detailed sound. Use a pair as rear home theater surrounds with Playbar, Playbase, or Beam. Connect wirelessly to other Sonos speakers to enjoy brilliant sound in any or every room.
feature_bullets: Sonos One - The powerful smart speaker with voice control built in.
Brilliant sound - Get rich, room-filling sound with Sonos One, and control it with your voice, the Sonos app, Apple AirPlay2, and more.
Voice control - Amazon Alexa is built right in so you can play music, check news, set alarms, get your questions answered, and more, completely hands free.

For every room - The compact design fits just about any space. Put it on your kitchen countertop or tuck it away on your office bookshelf. It's humidity resistant so you can even put it in the bathroom.
Stereo sound with two - Pair two Sonos Ones together in the same room for stereo separation and more detailed sound. Use a pair as rear home theater surrounds with Playbar, Playbase, or Beam.
Build your system - Connect wirelessly to other Sonos speakers to enjoy brilliant sound in any or every room.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,488 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #124 in Portable Bluetooth Speakers#1,100 in MP3 & MP4 Player Accessories
